definition: to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]

sentences.english: Over the following three weeks, I sat in daily meditation for only five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 在接下來的三週，我每日坐禪僅5分鐘。

sentences.english: Zazen is meticulous work and details are important.
sentences.chinese: 坐禪需要一絲不苟，細節是關鍵。

sentences.english: It was originally drunk before meditation to help with mental awareness and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 起初抹茶是在坐禪前飲用的，來幫助清醒頭腦。

sentences.english: You need to be as comfortable as possible during zazen so that you can sit without moving.
sentences.chinese: 坐禪的時候要坐得舒服，這樣纔可以坐得久而不挪位。

sentences.english: Researchers discovered that the Zen meditators did have an edge over the control group.
sentences.chinese: 研究者發現，坐禪者確實比對照組有優勢。

sentences.english: If you're new to meditation, remember that it's a practice.
sentences.chinese: 如果你剛開始坐禪，記住這是一種練習。

definition: to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
one's four limbs/two arms and two legs
method of counting (e.g. decimal or Roman numbers)
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
the Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.
the Four Noble Truths (Buddhism)/see also 四諦|四谛[si4 di4] and 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
